cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the northern Yucatan Peninsula, then forecast to turn north-northeast across the Gulf of Mexico and accelerate toward the northern Gulf Coast before moving inland and curving over the southeastern U.S. toward the Mid-Atlantic coast.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm watches only in the Yucatan Peninsula and Gulf Coast states – none for the Mid-Atlantic shoreline.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Tulum to Dzilam, Mexico.  Tropical-Storm Warning: western Cuba and parts of northern Yucatan – none near Delaware.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact zone from the northern Yucatan, across the north-central Gulf Coast, then inland through AL/TN/GA and north-eastward to the Mid-Atlantic (VA–DE–NJ) coast.
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (isolated totals up to 6 inches mentioned for Mid-Atlantic)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance of tropical-storm-force winds (≤ 3%); more likely gusty 20–35 mph winds Thursday–Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on Delaware Bay; only minor tidal departures possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated higher amounts could trigger localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief reduced visibilities, ponding on terminal yards/roadways, and possible minor river/stream rises affecting landside access.
